EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network at positions (0.0, 0.0), (5.0, 0.0), (2.5, 0.5) & (2.5, -0.5)
Consists of:
• Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting at (0.0, 0.0) paired with a Burner Inserter at (1.5, 0.5).
• Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at (5.0, 0.0) with a Burner Inserter at (3.5, 0.5).
• Common Input Chest:
 – Wooden Chest at (2.5, 0.5) stocking copper-plate.
• New Feeder Inserter:
 – Feeder Inserter at (2.5, -0.5) with pickup at (2.5, -1.5) and drop at (2.5, 0.5).
• Transport Belt Connection:
 – BeltGroup linking mining output at (-14.5, -47.5) to the feeder inserter pickup (2.5, -1.5) using 64 belts.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup at position (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of:
• Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0) with output drop at (-14.5, -48.5).
• Drill Inserter at (-13.5, -47.5) transferring ore.
• Sink Chest & Output Extraction System:
 – Wooden Chest repositioned at (-13.5, -51.5) to serve as the sink.
• Supplemental Burner Inserter:
 – Burner Inserter at (-13.5, -52.5) with pickup at (-13.5, -53.5) and drop at (-13.5, -51.5).
• Transport Belt Connections:
 – Multiple transport belt connection attempts between the mining drill drop (-14.5, -48.5) and the intended inserter pickup points have failed, leaving the output unaccepted.
  Recent steps aimed to place an additional sink chest or connect directly to an inserter (target pickup at (-10.5, -48.5)), but these have not been successful.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Sink Chest Candidate & Buildability Issues:
 – Repeated candidate positions (e.g., (-14.5, -48.5), (-13.5, -48.5), (-15.5, -48.5), etc.) were tested and found non-buildable for a WoodenChest. Always validate grid alignment and clear surrounding obstructions before confirming a candidate placement.
 – When using placement helpers (such as placing an entity adjacent to a reference), ensure the target tile is truly empty; in one case a burner-inserter’s presence led to placement failure.

• Belt Connection & Path Normalization Failures:
 – Attempts to connect transport belts directly to a Prototype.WoodenChest target (or via an intermediary that is unprepared) resulted in errors. Use an inserter as the connection endpoint instead.
 – Several belt connection attempts failed due to path normalization errors; verify endpoints and all waypoints are grid-aligned and fall into buildable areas.

• Output Blockage and Obstruction Management:
 – The mining drill output remains blocked because no proper sink entity has been established. Ensure that any obstructing transport belt is cleared and that the connection chain correctly leads via an inserter.
 – When repositioning or connecting, factor in both proximity and buildability to avoid “too far” or “occupied tile” issues.

NAMESPACE
─────────
• shift_entity_local(entity: Entity, offset: Tuple[float, float]) -> Entity  
 – Shifts the given entity’s position by the specified offset.  
  • Success: Entity is repositioned correctly.  
  • Failure: Prototype mismatches may occur if identifier strings are not standardized.

• nearest_buildable(position: Position) -> BoundingBox  
 – Determines the nearest buildable area surrounding a given position for entity placement.  
  • Success: Returns a valid bounding box for placement.  
  • Failure: Misuse of property access (e.g., treating candidate_box.center as callable) can trigger errors.

• place_entity_next_to(prototype: Prototype, reference_position: Position, direction: Direction, spacing: int) -> Optional[Entity]  
 – Attempts to place an entity of the given prototype adjacent to a reference position according to the specified direction and spacing.  
  • Success: Returns the placed entity if the target cell is buildable and unoccupied.  
  • Failure: Returns an error if the target position is occupied (as by an existing burner-inserter) or otherwise invalid.

Important Variables:
• furnace_input_chest_pos (Position) – Holds the position of the furnace input chest.
• current_player_inventory (Inventory) – Tracks the current state of the player’s inventory.
• mining_drill_drop (Position) – Stores the mining drill’s output drop position (e.g., (-14.5, -48.5)).
• target_chest_position (Position) – Represents the position of the attempted connection target for transport belts (e.g., (-10.5, -48.5)).
